review_blob:
I ran across this beer in Ascain, quite close to where it is brewed in Sare. 

I ordered this expecting the watery flavorless liquid which normally passes for beer in warmer southerly climes but was very pleasantly surprised.  It has quite a lot of depth to the taste, with some very distinctly spicy notes.  This was a really pleasant surprise!  

I have posted a pic here: http://www.flickr.com/photos/david_nicholai/128904

A hazy, bubbly beer with off goldish color.  The head was lingering and slightly off white.  The smell is citrus, with some not too subtle richness promising strength and maltiness.  Some coppery notes.  Found some lingering barnyard.  The taste is soft and warm, although not nearly as strong as I had hoped for . A very pleasant beer, but not as full blown as I had hoped for.

Copper colored - with honey or maple syrup in the smell.  Also some metallic and burnt flavors. A Very acidic bitterness in the taste with some candy sugar undertones. Lingering hop taste on the tongue.
Almost black beer with some red highlights at the edges of the glass. A warming, malty smell with some corn sugar notes. Balanced fresh and hoppy taste.
Clear yellow gold beer with med. head. A relatively flat taste with lingering metallic hoppyness. I think it might be made from a hop extract.  Rather thickish palate.

Hazy orange yellow color with a very shy head.  Its there, but it fades quickly. Something a little bit off in the taste, but my bottle had been forgotten in our cave for a bit too long... Relatively organic taste that is pleasant but not exceptional.

Very nice little local brewery, This particular beer is smells yeasty with the chestnut not punching through as much as Id hoped.  Its there through.  The taste is well rounded, but again not overly chestnut.  A sweet balance with no discernible aftertaste. Might improve with age.
This beer is very accessible in France. Very fraiche citrus nose with some barnyard.  Yeasty. A warming taste with some alcohol.  Somehow I would describe it as brassy

Hazy gold yellow color with a three finger head. Nice smell with barnyard, yellow citrus, yeast, but not particularly defined. Some alcohol is to be found in the taste, as well as medium bitterness with little hop.  Very thirst quenching, very drinkable - not so complex.

On tap @ Kaisla.  A clear-gold pour with some serious cloud like head. Barnyard, hoppy, and fresh citrus smell. The taste is iron, very hoppy with some fresh cut grass notes, no alcohol, just fresh.  Great warm and cold weather beer alike. Made with the same hop variety that goes into Westvleterns brews.

I was very taken with this beer.  Beautiful in the glass, wonderful smell, and a taste that delivers what it promises.  The nose is metallic (not a bad thing), sweet, grainy malt, yeast, and citrus freshness. Not cloying like some Xmas beers. Also some grape and plum notes.  The taste is equally complex - nutty, subtly spiced, rich and complex and very easy drinking.  I have enormous respect for this brewery.
Intensely cardamon.  If you dont LOVE cardamon, you probably wont be able to finish one of these yourself.  Maybe mine was overspiced or part of a bad batch, but I think the premise is good.
Smells of almond, cake, sweetness, yeast, and some lesser astringent and metallic hints.  A predominantly bitter taste with some sweet and metal  - not particularly complex though.
A hazy honey color in the glass.  A very sour taste in the mouth, with with sour apple and acidic impressions. No hops.  Not very drinkable.
Medium to small head, dark gold color.  The taste is quite sweet for a lager, some alcohol and banana notes.  Not great, but then again I wasnt expecting much.

33 cl bottle @ Kaisla Christmas Menu.  The smell is heady, sweet and alcohol with some phenols - almost like a very organic apple cider.  Warming taste, evident alcohol, yeast, and something sweet and tannic. Highly recommended.
beer_name: Caulier Bon Secours Blonde de Nol

review_blob: Kaisla on their Christmas menu.  75cL bottle.  Hazy with a hazel-white head.  Smell was complex - citrus tartness, wheat, yeast, barnyard and several things I just cant put into words.  The taste - even more so... Warm, metallic, caramel, no alcohol whatsoever.  A very organic tasting beer.

Beautiful and black witha two finger tan head. Almost salty taste, with peanut, chocolate, creamy, and roasted tones.  Earlier Rating: 5/30/2005 Total Score: 3.7A very drinkable doppelbock, large head and brownish body, the aroma has some barnyard, green hay, and hops.  The taste is somewhat smoky, burnt coffee, sweet, with a very slight sourness at the finish.
Dark, but not completely black.  A very soft and round taste with little or no bitterness, mellowness, and very well masked alcohol.

A very charming beer that doesnt deliver in terms of taste.  Beautiful champagne cholored with a fulminant white head that lingers.  Fresh hoppy smell - again the taste leaves somethign to be desired.
Copper gold color, with a head that doesnt linger. A very rich and creamy tasting beer.  Hard hitting bitterness.
A black mass with a tan leather head.  The smell is also leathery, sweet, and damp.  The taste is gin and tonic bitter.  They might have overdone the hops here.  A very smooth beer all in all.

Bottled from 95.  Very smell head, whiskey brown color.   The smell is amazing, raisins, cork, mulled spices, glgi, plums, prunes, and some other things I identify as very distinctly meaty.  The taste does not disappoint.  Some cognac, very sweet, evident sweet grains (think horses sweetfeed).  Definitely a sipping beer.

I was dissapointed with this one. The smell is skunky, and not altogether unpleasant mildew.  Actually a smell rather reminiscent of reasonably good grade marijuana.  Obviously, this is the hops coming throuh.  The taste, unfortunately, is thin and watery.
An uncloudy copper red.  Nice coffee coloured head.  Smells of rum, warm, strong, honey, and mulled spices.  A maltly sweet and bitter tase.  Some milkyness.
Bottle. Clearish red with white head.  Smells of warmth, honey, and grasses.  A taste reminiscent of grain, with some caramel character.

Bottle @ Delirium Cafe.  Cloudy orange brown appearance. Medium head.  The smell is amazing.  Molasses, grain mill like richness and organic references. Just overwhelming.  The taste is also excellent, but not quite as good as the nose belies. No alcohol found whatsoever, more bitter than sweet, quaffable, but not quite a bush 7.
Bottle.  Golden pour with large white head.  Nice aroma of alcohol, yeast, esthers, and citrus.  A very brassy taste, dry and warming, with evident hops.  Concealed alcohol.

Bottled.  cork was soaked when I opened it, obviously not an ideal condition.  Ciderish appearance. The smell is damp, not sure if that came from the cork problem. Sweet, green and astringent notes in the nose as well.  No alcohol, with an initial rush of flavor. Lambicish with good balance.  Palate was surprisingly lively for the bottles condition.

Bottle from 2003.  Beautiful appearance.  Hazy coffee brown with smooth uniform head that stays.  The smell has alcohol, raisin, caramel, and mulled spices (maybe coriander or cardamon).  A very warming taste, burnt caramel, lingering sweetness balanced with some small bitterness.  Evident warming, a very drinkable craft beer.
on tap in London.  The appearance is clear chestnut amber.  Woody, sweet, lager nose.  The taste has metallic notes.  A pleasant but flat flavor.
Black cola colors, thick white head with dissapears quickly.  The taste is soft, malty, and a bit creamy.
Bloody copper, big fady head.  Smell is yeasy , hoppy, and some smoke.  The taste is bitter and rounded, dry grains, and fruit.  Palate, unforunately, was watery
fiery red copper color, but the taste was somewhat of a let down.  I was expecting a more complex taste.  I found it a bit thin.
Cherry wood color, quickly dissipating head.  Smell is balsamic vinegar, woody, some cherry, tart, and sweet.  The taste is almost lip puckering, grapefruit, and lingering tart.

Hazy, like lambic.  Foamy white head which lasts.  The aroma is tart, yeast, sharp but no hops, dry white wine dryness.  The taste is marvelous.  No alcohol, no malt, no hops.  Just tart, and warming.  Quite fruity yet dry. Some metallic notes.

beer_brewer_name: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review_blob: Cherry brown pour with some cloudiness.  The taste is sweet malt, some unfermented notes (kotikalja).  Relatively unpretentious and very drinkable.

Having recently sampled some of the great belgian strong ales, I must admit my hopes were perhaps too lofty for this beer.  Boon has its roots as a lambic specialist, and this is their first foray into strong ales.  

Pretty pour, licorice brown, with cherry colors as well depending on the light.  The smell is metallic, citrus, and sweet.  I think perhaps it was served a bit too cold for me to fully appreciate the nose. 

The taste is sour, with some apple, yeast, and citric hints.

I was hoping for better things from this famous brewery.  The smell is somewhat artificial, with pineapple, caramel, yeast, and some very evident metallic associations.  The taste was a bitter and uncomplicated, overly simple impression.  Refreshing, but not very rewarding in terms of flavor or mouthfeel.  No evident alcohol in either the taste or the nose.  Perhaps a bit too fizzy.

I liked this one.  Not exceptional, definitely not an everyday beer, but an interesting experience nonetheless.  The smell has some odd associations, cherry glue, sweet, almost artificial and cloying, with very candy notes.  

Teaste is not as sweet as belied by the smell.  Very sippable.

draught @ pikkulintu.  Cloudy, brownish with a 2 finger head, craggy head.  Apple, yeast, and sweetness in the aroma - almost overwhelmed by some smoky hints.  The taste is sweet, with a lingering aftertaste.  No apparent alcohol.  Slight bite.  A tad bit watery.

This was an absolute pleasure to drink.  Evident alcohol, with a sweet lingering aftertaste.  A sharp, almost pointy taste.  Impressive offset of its huge sweetness with a brassy acidic taste.  The palate acts to optimally bring out the taste to its fullest.  

Beautiful appearance, yellow gold with small whitish head. A nice head, but not too pillowy.  

Smell has an almost vinous character, caramel, grain, damp, oaky alcohol.
This is a relatively poor lager, although I drink it in a less then ideal condition, as I am not sure that lager is meant to be put down as long as this bottle was.
Light gold color, with a quickly dissapating head.  The smell is sweet, acidly fruity, A creamy taste, with balanced bitterness, nice and pleasant aftertaste.  Very smooth beer.
Very bubbly, huge rocky head.  Copper rouge color.  The smell is acidic, oaky, almost resinous.  Delicious acidly sweet with no aftertaste.  Some yeast and metal notes.

750mL Bottle.  Pour reddish-brown actually a bit like amber because of the amount of sediment in suspension.  Had a fizzy, big head.  The smells of metal, yeast, pineapple, alcohol, oak, honey, earth.  All in all, too much to put a finger on all of them.  The taste is simultaneously rich and subtle. Very well balanced, sweet bitter, with no evident alcohol notes.  Metallic with a sweet finish which goes on and on.

Black as night, with a smallish coffee colored head. Leaves serious amounts of sediment in the bottom of the glass.  Smells burnt, almost oily, coffee, caramel, and some suggestion of strawberry.  the taste is dominated by the alcoholic overtones, and blocks out most everything else save the lingering bittersweetness.
Yellow haze colored with a minimal head.  The smell is wheat beer, yeast, hops, citrus, clover smell.  A sharp, bitterish taste with an unidentifiable bit.  Lingers sweet on the tongue.

Brownish red with a quickly dissapearing, leaves some belgian lace.  Lovely smell of grapes, yeast, earthy, caramel and oak.  The taste is smooth and velvety, but not as busy as the smell. Well masked alcohol.

yellowish clear with a medium small head.  Smell remiscent of white wine, cork, and sweet.  The taste is lovely, corn, caramel, oaky, minimal alcohol, no aftertaste.  Very clear and clean taste.  Thin but solid palate.  Very drinkable!
